alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 7:16AM EDT until March 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Wayne and Holmes Counties. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooded roads in and near Killbuck include Water Street, County Road 621, State Route 60 south, State Route 520, as well as local low lying roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EDT Monday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 12.2 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 07/15/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM EDT.
